description: Number of partitions of n into parts congruent to 2 mod 3.
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = 1/n*Sum_{k=1..n} A078182(k)*a(n-k), a(0) = 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 21 2002Euler transform of period 3 sequence [ 0, 1, 0, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 24 2007a(n) ~ GAMMA(2/3) * exp(sqrt(2*n)*Pi/3) / (2^(11/6) * sqrt(3) * Pi^(1/3) * n^(5/6)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 26 2015
mathematica: nmax=100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1-x^(3*k+2)),{k, 0, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 26 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n)= if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( 1 / prod( k=1, n, 1 - (k%3==2) * x^k, 1 + x * O(x^n)), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 24 2007 */
author: _Olivier GÃ©rard_
